fields.summary: BZip2 drops records when reading data in splits

fields.summary: Bzip2Codec: Data block is skipped when position of newly created stream is equal to start of split

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Unit test TestTextInputFormat.testSplitableCodecs() failed when the seed is  1313094493.

Stacktrace
java.lang.AssertionError: Key in multiple partitions.
at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
at org.junit.Assert.assertFalse(Assert.java:64)
at org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestTextInputFormat.testSplitableCodecs(TestTextInputFormat.java:223)
fields.summary: BZip2CompressionInputStream finds the same compression marker twice in corner case, causing duplicate data blocks

comments.body: When seed is 855631073 it also fails.

It seems to be caused by non checking corner case when byte alignment of data and current position of stream is same. In this case BZip2 stream can return same block marker same to previous one. 
I fixed {{BZip2Codec}} and added above test cases.

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks [~haibochen] and [~boky01] for reporting this and thanks [~lewuathe] for providing the patch.
Hi [~lewuathe], this patch looks to be reverting HADOOP-11445, so the change would cause HADOOP-11445 again. What do you think?

[~ajisakaa] Thanks you so much for checking related JIRA. As you said, I found the current patch will cause same problem fixed in HADOOP-11445 although a patch in HADOOP-11445 also seems cause this problem.
So looks like we need to investigate further and solve root cause. I'll look into and update the patch.

I found {{BZip2Codec}} always back 10bytes to search compression marker even markers except for first marker has 6bytes. It can let {{BZip2CompressionInputStream}} find same marker twice because the search start points is back more than marker size. I fixed compression stream only back 6bytes other than the file start point.
